      • openWorkbook

        public static Workbook openWorkbook(java.io.File file)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Open workbook file.

        This method inspects the file name extension to determine which factory should be used for loading. If there are multiple factories registered for the extension, the matching factories are tried in sequential order. If loading succeeds, the workbook is returned.

        Parameters:
        file - the workbook file
        Returns:
        the workbook loaded from file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if workbook could not be loaded

      • getFileExtension

        public static java.lang.String getFileExtension(java.io.File file)
        Extract file extension.

        The file extension is the part of the filename from the last dot to the end (including the dot). The extension of the file /foo/bar/file.txt is ".txt".

        If the filename doesn't contain a dot, the extension is the empty string ("").

        Parameters:
        file - the file
        Returns:
        the file extension including the dot.

      • getCellRef

        public static java.lang.String getCellRef(Cell cell,
                                          RefOption... options)
        Get cell reference as string.
        Parameters:
        cell -
        options - Options to use
        Returns:
        the cell in Excel conventions, ie "A1" for the first cell.

        public static <WORKBOOK extends Workbook> WORKBOOK cloneWorkbookAs(java.lang.Class<WORKBOOK> clazz,
                                                                   Workbook workbook)
        Return copy of workbook in a different implementation.
        Type Parameters:
        WORKBOOK - the workbook class of the target
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class instance for the workbook class of the target
        workbook - the source workbook
        Returns:

        public static void copySheetData(Sheet dst,
                                 Sheet src)
        Copy sheet data.

        Copies all data from one sheet to another. Sheets may be instances of different implementation classes.

        Parameters:
        dst - the destination sheet
        src - the source sheet
